question: The Central Government has announced setting up two National Kamdhenu Breeding Centres. The centres are being established in which of the following two states?
explanation: In order to conserve the indigenous breeds, two National Kamdhenu Breeding Centres- one in Chintaladevi, in Andhra Pradesh and the other one in Itarsi, Hoshangabad are being set up. In these centres, 41 cattle and 13 buffalo breeds would be conserved. The mission aims at increasing the milk production in the country in a scientific manner.
